Text:
If you like this small upload, please comment and let me know, I'll start uploading more of my stashed goodies. (not just games)

-rogue
do these emulators run on powerpc or intel based macs.  thanks

I have an intel based Mac, but the specific web pages don't specify mostly, if you're running a power PC I would suggest trying it anyway, that way for future reference there can be a performance comparison.

-Rogue
doesnt run on an intel mac, only a powerpc mac. i had the mame emulator on my power ppc and it worked great but it wont run on the intel mac unless u install something called Rosetta

Rosetta is natively on the Intel MAC, I'm running an Intel MAC right now, and I'll tell you straight up I have never installed Rosetta. 

REFERENCE:
http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1730

EXERT:
Summary

Mac OS X applications that can run natively on both Intel processor- and PowerPC processor-based Macs are called Universal applications. Even if you don't have a Universal version of an application, you can still use it on an Intel processor-based Mac by means of Rosetta, which comes with every Intel-based Mac.
I think rosetta is getting dumped in 10.8.  I'm sure most of these could be found in universal form or intel only by now?

actually rosetta was already dumped in 10.7. In 10.6 it was not part of the default  OS install but if you tried to run a PPC app it would download it, or if you did a customized install of 10.6 it was an optional install.
